conclusion: A cannot pass through the group of squares smoothly.
The toy car carries enough speed to knock over light obstacles; it is not creeping forward.
In the second frame, the car is already making contact with the nearest red stack.
The car’s body intersects the available passage rather than fitting between the stacks.
Once the first impact occurs, the car’s heading is deflected toward the other columns.
Even if the red blocks topple out of the way, the sideways impulse sends the car toward the green or blue columns, creating a chain of further collisions instead of a clean exit.
The car’s trajectory is obstructed at the very first encounter, producing knock-over impacts and course deviation; it never manages an unobstructed path all the way through the square columns.
